channel.title: alhinds.com
channel.description: A collection of posts about web development, design and more.

item.title: Abstraction
item.description: What is abstraction and how does it apply to programming? One of my original blogs about programming!
item.dc:creator: Alex Hinds

item.title: What really changed my mind about AI - LLM functions
item.description: Large language models are wildly powerful, but their weakness is their inability to properly understand their own limitations. Functions are the key to unlocking their potential.
item.dc:creator: Alex Hinds

item.title: A morbid curiosity - why do people do extreme caving?
item.description: YouTube served me a video of the Nutty Putty cave incident. I went down a rabbit hole.
item.dc:creator: Alex Hinds

item.title: I built a Tailwind preset
item.description: I wanted to play around with setting up and managing a shared configuration for tailwind. It's pretty simple.
item.dc:creator: Alex Hinds

item.title: Migrating to Next.js 13's app router
item.description: I wanted to try and migrate to the Next.js's app router and server components and test how much it tested my mental model and assumptions.
item.dc:creator: Alex Hinds

item.title: Predictions for 2026
item.description: The technical and product landscape will change dramatically in 2026.
item.dc:creator: Alex Hinds

item.title: How I made my resumé into a website
item.description: A while back I designed and built my resumé in HTML. I’ve recently transformed the same HTML into a proper website.
item.dc:creator: Alex Hinds

item.title: Don’t ignore the basics: JS, CSS, HTML
item.description: Why the building blocks of the web remain the core drivers of success in the modern web.
item.dc:creator: Alex Hinds

item.title: The tools I use for software development
item.description: What I'm using to build and design software in 2023. Tools, frameworks equipment and infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: Alex Hinds

item.title: So you're trying to build a website?
item.description: A fun little article on the absurdities and overwhelming depth of becoming a first-time web developer.
item.dc:creator: Alex Hinds

item.title: How I became a web developer
item.description: My own journey wading into the world of web dev. It’s not as easy as it looks, it takes time, and it’s not for everyone.
item.dc:creator: Alex Hinds

item.title: What's the use of C's header files?
item.description: Header files in C fulfil a few key principles of good modular programming allowing us to separate out our related logic, reuse or not use elements of logic in different files as we see fit and provide an agreed common interface for implementation.
item.dc:creator: Alex Hinds

item.title: Frontend Performance: Why Lighthouse has made us lazy
item.description: The greatest trap of optimising web application performance is failing to understand the limitations of the tools we use to measure it, and the type of performance we’re trying to extract.
item.dc:creator: Alex Hinds
